title: Here are the nations coming to Boston for the 2026 FIFA World Cup
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: World Cup Gillette Stadium, which FIFA has labeled "Boston Stadium," will host seven World Cup games.
Here's the updated schedule after the group stage draw.
2026 FIFA World Cup branding seen at Gillette Stadium in June.

title: How Craig Breslow views new Red Sox pitcher Johan Oviedo
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Boston Red Sox The Red Sox acquired Oviedo in a trade with the Pirates on Thursday.
Johan Oviedo had been with the Pirates since 2022.

(AP Photo/Kareem Elgazzar By Conor Roche December 6, 2025 | 12:07 PM 2 minutes to read The Red Sox swung an interesting trade on Thursday when they acquired right-handed pitcher Johan Oviedo from the Pirates for outfielder Jhostynxon Garcia as part of a five-player deal.

title: Bo Bichette reportedly viewed by Red Sox as ‘intriguing’ option if they lose Alex Bregman
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Boston Red Sox Bichette became a free agent after helping the Blue Jays come within a win of winning the World Series.
Bo Bichette has been one of the best hitters for average in baseball in recent years.

(AP Photo/David Zalubowski) By Conor Roche December 6, 2025 | 11:23 AM 2 minutes to read Alex Bregman hasn’t made a decision about his future yet, but the Red Sox seem to be lining up backup plans in case he leaves Boston.

title: Parents give ringing endorsement to school cellphone ban in new poll
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Local News About two-thirds of Massachusetts parents support banning phones and smartwatches in schools, according to a new poll.

A new poll finds that the majority of Massachusetts parents support a statewide ban on cellphones and smartwatches during the school day, as legislators weigh whether to pass a bill to keep the devices out of classrooms.
The poll, released Thursday and conducted by Boston-based nonprofit The MassINC Polling Group, found that 66 percent of parents would back a ban.

title: Brookline family sues over death of ‘matriarch’ in crosswalk
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Local News Margie Mendez, 86, was running errands in Chestnut Hill on Jan.
15 when she was struck by a trooper making a right turn onto Route 9.
The family of an 86-year-old Brookline woman who died months after a police cruiser struck her as she crossed the street is suing the Massachusetts State Police.

title: Mysterious chip found in Brighton ATM as ‘skimming’ incidents increase
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Crime Boston police report a recent increase in the use of illegal skimming devices across the Commonwealth.
As the holidays approach and shoppers descend on countless stores across Massachusetts, police are warning of a recent uptick in the use of illegal credit card skimming devices.
“The Boston Police Department is aware of a recent increase in the use of credit card skimming devices across the state of Massachusetts,” the agency said in a recent alert.

title: New law increases penalties for assaulting a T worker
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Local News Transit employees will soon have some extra protection against aggressive passengers.
A new Massachusetts law that goes into effect next year strengthens protections for public transit workers amid a steep rise in assaults, state officials announced.
Gov.

title: How a model’s work affects her dating life
author: Meredith Goldstein
bullets: Love Letters This week's Love Letters podcast guest — a part-time model — doesn't want to quit her job to find a healthy relationship.
A couple enjoys the colorful view along the Kancamagus Highway.

title: After nine years with Celtics, Marcus Smart is ‘excited and proud’ to be a Laker
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Boston Celtics "It was weird at first.
I definitely didn't think that would be a possibility but I'm enjoying every last bit of it.

title: Without LeBron James and Luka Doncic, Celtics-Lakers somehow felt like ‘just another game’
author: Khari A. Thompson
